point.title: Introductions. Describes entry into military service, induction at Fort Sheridan and training at Fort Bragg. Recalls being shipped out to England and Northern Ireland. Details assignment to 5th Infantry Division and training in Northern Ireland. Remembers landing at Normandy Beach and joining 3rd Army with General Patton. Recalls fighting Germans for 28 straight days.

Recalls combat through Europe including laying smoke for river crossings. Remembers being in southern German during the Battle of the Bulge and providing support for this engagement. Describes fighting through Czechoslovakia and meeting Russian soldiers. Recalls being home on furlough when Japan was bombed and learning about the end of the war.
Remembers being asked to serve as a pallbearer for another veteran's funeral in Popular, Wisconsin.

Recalls getting news from the Stars and Stripes newspaper while overseas and following Dick Bong's flying career. Remembers seeing General Patton on several occasions and appreciating his talks to troops. Recalls 700-mile journey in 28 days in detail including supplies and food, transportation, and other details.

Discusses various weapons and ammunition used in the Army during World War II including items for night fighting/firing. Recalls night fighting in detail and process for deployment different guns on the line. Talks about using the 105 to eliminate tracks.
Describes job on the gun crew. Talks further about 105 shells. Recalls other armament used in battles.

Describes discharge process at Fort Campbell, Kentucky. Remembers hearing about the attack on Pearl Harbor while home on the farm. Describes trench foot and soldiers experiences taking care of their feet in different climates.

Remembers receiving battle stars (awards) for five engagements. Details experiences in the Battle of the Bulge and Belgium. Recalls service under General Patton and other soldiers' impressions of Patton.
Recalls childhood with Major Richard I. Bong and growing up together. Remembers playing hockey and deer hunting with Bong. Describes deer hunting.

Recalls civilian response to U.S. troops in France and their support for the U.S. Army. Describes German refugees. Remembers drinking wine in France. Remembers rotating off the line in France and taking a three-day break in Paris. Recalls mail delivery while in Europe and mail censorship. Remembers return to U.S. from Europe.

record.description: Mike Isaacson was born on November 30, 1918 in Poplar, Wisconsin. Isaacson was a veteran of WWII, having served in the U.S. Army under General Patton. Isaacson describes entry into military service and joining the 5th Infantry Division. Remembers landing at Normandy Beach and fighting across Europe. Describes a noteworthy engagement where his unit pushed forward 700 miles and 28 days straight. Recalls interactions with General George S. Patton and participating in the Battle of the Bulge. Recalls serving as a pallbearer for Major Richard I. Bong. Describes experiences on the gun crew including various weapons and ammunition. Isaacson passed away on July 16, 2007 in Superior, Wisconsin. Obituary: https://www.superiortelegram.com/news/1921994-martin-mike-f-isaacson.
